meanings.definition: To have enough money or time for something.
meanings.sent1: She affords to buy a new book every month.
meanings.sent2: He affords to take a vacation once a year.
meanings.sent3: Saving money affords her the chance to treat herself occasionally.
meanings.sent4: His hard work affords him the luxury of enjoying small pleasures.
meanings.sent5: Being frugal affords you the ability to save for the future.

meanings.sent1: The library affords a wide range of books for readers.
meanings.sent2: The restaurant affords delicious meals for its customers.
meanings.sent3: His garden affords fresh vegetables for his family.
meanings.sent4: The scholarship affords students the opportunity to pursue higher education.
meanings.sent5: The charity affords support to those in need.

meanings.definition: To offer an opportunity or possibility.
meanings.sent1: The new job affords a chance for career growth.
meanings.sent2: The workshop affords participants a chance to learn new skills.
meanings.sent3: His creativity affords him the chance to explore different hobbies.
meanings.sent4: The program affords students the possibility of studying abroad.
meanings.sent5: The event affords attendees the opportunity to network with professionals.
